data.title: enhancement request: define store
data.body:
Suggested syntax:

```
define store x=2
```

Creates variable x in the store prior to launch, so x can participate in rollback/save.

data.title: renpy.music.get_duration() returns 0.0
data.body:
If music is started by MusicRoom get_duration() returns 0.0, if music started in game using 'play' keyword - functions works okay.
So AudioPositionValue (that seems works using this function) does strange things.
![Screenshot](http://puu.sh/qcwc3/65bebdafc2.png)

data.title: extra slashes in filenames cause build problems
data.body:
```
<karorogunso> IOError: Couldn't find file 'images//gui//kimoi-text-name-bg.png'.
<karorogunso> style.window.background = Frame("images//gui//kimoi-text-name-bg.png", 12, 12)
```

Extra slashes work okay in standard directory tree but don't parse in .rpas, can be confusing

data.title: Fix some typos...
data.body: ...in style properties.

data.title: Lambdas inside screen use global namespace
data.body:
Short (and synthetic) demonstration:

``` renpy
label main_menu:
    return

label start:
    $ x = 'fail'
    show screen test_screen
    "..."
    return

screen test_screen:
    frame:
        xalign 0.5 yalign 0.5
        has vbox
        $ x = 'ok'
        $ f = lambda: x
        $ r = f()
        text "[r]" # expected: 'ok', got: 'fail'
```

I think that makes lambdas inside screen useless and even potentially harmful, if name collisions occur. Perhaps it could be too complicated (compared to gain) to properly implement screen lambdas, but in that case it might be a good idea to forbid them.

data.title: Error installing rapt on 6.99.10
data.body:
There's been an update of the Android SDK recently that changes the name of two folders. 
And since RenPy hasn't taken that into account yet, there's a conflict.
Go to : renpy-sdk\rapt\android-sdk/extras/google/
The folders previously known as Â« play_apk_expansion Â» and Â« play_licensing Â» are now called 
Â« market_apk_expansion Â» and 
Â« market_licensing Â».

data.title: game in window mode, use windows default close button will cause a small flash
data.body:
OS: Windows 10 64 bit

1\ Run renpy game in â€˜winows modeâ€™ (not full screen mode)
2\ Activate transitions (set the transitions preference to be â€˜Trueâ€™)
3\ Use the system default red close button on the upper right to try to close the game.
4\ Click â€˜cancelâ€™ on the popup confirmation window.

Problemï¼š
The game window will flash for one or two times before the confirmation window disappear(dissolve). 
This tiny problem will not appear when close transition (transitions preference set 'False').
Closing game by using buttons with 'action Quit()' and then choose 'cancel' will not cause this problem.

the yes_no prompt code is as follows:

```
screen yesno_prompt(message, yes_action, no_action):
    tag yesno
    modal True

    window:

        xpadding 0.0
        ypadding 0.0

        if not in_game or _in_replay:
            if message == layout.QUIT:
                add "black_bg.png"
        else:
            if message == layout.QUIT:
                add "black_bg.png" alpha 0.2
        add "dialog_bg.png":
            align 0.5,0.5

        text _(message):
            align 0.5,0.43

        imagebutton:
            idle "ui/dialog/dialog_yes.png"
            action yes_action

        imagebutton:
            idle "ui/dialog/dialog_no.png"
            action no_action

    key "mouseup_3" action no_action
    key "game_menu" action no_action
```

while black_bg.png is a full game window size pure color image with no opacity, dialog_bg.png is a smaller picture.
Seems that only the confirmation window background (dialog_bg.png) in the center will flash, the black background (black_bg.png) dissolves smoothly.

data.title: Gallery advance through locked images not working.
data.body:
I'm trying to figure out why "g.locked = True" dosen't show me only my unlocked images.
(I'm using unlock_image(*images) in my gallery)
Well, looking a the 00gallery.rpy I can't really figure out how the result gets the "next_unlocked" value... so that this condition "if self.locked and result.endswith("_unlocked")" will be True.

```
        # Loop, displaying the images.
        while True:

            b = self.button_list[button]
            i = b.images[image]

            result = i.show((button, image) not in unlocked_images, image, len(b.images))

            # Default action for click.

            if result is True:
                result = "next"

            if result == 'return':
                break

            # At this point, result is either 'next', "next_unlocked", "previous", or "previous_unlocked"
            # Go through the common advance code.

            if self.locked and result.endswith("_unlocked"):
                images = unlocked_images
            else:
                images = all_images
```

wouldn't that be enought?: 

```
            if self.locked:
                images = unlocked_images
            else:
                images = all_images
```

or this?:

```
        if self.locked or result.endswith("_unlocked"):
            images = unlocked_images
        else:
            images = all_images
```

data.title: How to change opacity of say screen background in preference screen by Bar
data.body:
my say screen has a background:

```
screen say:
        window:
            id "window"
            background None
            add "saybg.png" alpha persistent.sayopacity
            ...
```

with opacity given by persistent.sayopacity

how to change its value by bar?
Currently im writing like follows:

```
screen preferences:
    ....
    bar value FieldValue(??,"persistent.sayopacity",?? .... )
    ....
```

I don't know how to finish this or if this is the correct way to do it.

plz help and thx a lot.

data.title: Alt+Shift Not Registering
data.body:
It seems on neither Mac nor PC does alt+shift+letter register. 
alt+letter registers and shift+letter registers, but alt+shift+letter gives no love.
